answers.answer: It could be carpal tunnel. I would see either a orthopedic hand specialist or a neurologist. Do you do repetitive work, type on the computer a lot or play an instrument?
It could also be diabetes you should mention it to you're doctor.

Hi there! Basically what you're experiencing now can be mild or can be something serious. You haven't mentioned about the activities you were doing before you felt that numbness. It can be normal when your arms or hands have been exerting great force or work during the day. It can also be an early sign of carpal tunnel syndrome where your nerve in your wrist is compressed. Taking Vitamiun b complex may help ease the pain. take care!

question: I have a numbness feeling in my arms and hands. Like the other day I was grocery shopping and my hands went numb while I was pushing the cart. Any idea what this could be?
title: Numbness in arms and hands
